DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to compare the safety and efficacy of Mapracorat Ophthalmic Suspension, 3% to vehicle for the treatment of postoperative inflammation and pain following cataract surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Mapracorat Ophthalmic Suspension, 3% for the Treatment of Ocular Inflammation Following Cataract Surgery
DOC.criteria: Subjects who are candidates for routine, uncomplicated cataract surgery. Subjects must be willing to wait to undergo cataract surgery on the fellow eye until after the study has been completed. Subjects who are expected to require treatment with any systemic or ocular (either eye) drugs specified in the protocol during the 18 days following cataract surgery or any systemic or ocular corticosteroids within 14 days prior to cataract surgery. Subjects who have known hypersensitivity or contraindication to the study drug(s) or their components. Subjects who have a severe/serious ocular condition or history/presence of chronic generalized systemic disease that the Investigator feels might increase the risk to the subject or confound the result(s) of the study.
